intro: Cracca frutescens, commonly known as the yellow tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound umbels of small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Cracca frutescens is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
